snippet: The dollar volume of deals fell 21.9 percent from the first half of 2011, to $1.1 trillion, according to data from Thomson Reuters, as an economic malaise held back mergers and acquisitions.
abstract: The dollar volume of deals fell 21.9 percent from the first half of 2011, to $1.1 trillion, according to data from Thomson Reuters, as an economic malaise held back mergers and acquisitions.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

headline.main: Sour Global Economy Drains Confidence From Deal Makers
